translated: Stories of Departed Spirits
The Great Chapter
. The Story of the Departed Spirits in a Group
“You are lean, ugly, and wretched,
emaciated, with veins protruding all over your body;🔽you are breathless, and your skin is wrinkled—

analyzed: ke nu tumhā itthā mārisa ati
translated: who are you, sirs?”
“We are departed spirits, reverend Sir,
who have gone to the departed spirits’ realm from here,
having done bad deeds,
and having gone to the departed spirits’ realm from here.”

analyzed: kim nu kāyena vācāya  manasā dukkaṭam kata
translated: “What bad deed was done by body, speech, or mind;
by what deed’s result
have you gone to the departed spirits’ realm from here?”

analyzed: anāvaṭesu titthesu  vici nimha ddha māsaka
translated: “At fords that were not blocked off,🔽we stole half a māsaka coin;
when there were things to be given,
we did not make an island for ourselves.
We went to the river, exhausted,
but it turned back empty;
we went to the shade in the heat,
but the heat turned back.
The wind, which was like fire,
blew, burning us;
this, reverend Sir, we deserve,
and another evil deed than that.
We went for leagues,

analyzed: āhāra gedhino  a laddhā ava nivattāma
translated: exhausted, with our mouths dry;🔽but not getting (anything), we turned back,
alas, our merit is small.
We are exhausted, and we are thirsty, reverend Sir,
and we are rolling on the ground;
We were stretched out, covered in dust,
and we fell down on our faces.
And there we fell down,
and were covered with dust on the ground;
We bumped our chests and our heads,
thinking, ‘Oh, how little merit we have!’
And this, Sir, we deserve,
and something worse than that,
when there are things to give to the contented,
we have not made merit for the next world.

original: Te hi nūna ito gantvā,🔽yoniṁ laddhāna mānusiṁ;
analyzed: te hi nūnar itas gantvā  yonim laddhāna mā anusi
translated: But perhaps, having gone from here,🔽and having obtained a human birth,
generous and accomplished in virtue,
we will make much merit.”
The Story of the Group-of-six Monks is the tenth.
